Class Display

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.oakland.classProject.production.Display

  • public class Display
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds the methods involved with displaying the command line interface.
    Version:
    "version 0.0.2" "150803"
    Author:
    Bart Tokarz / Ashley Taylor

    • Method Detail

      • getPlaySelection

        public char getPlaySelection()
        This method displays the main screen to the user. User must select an option.
        Returns:
        char This returns the selection entered by user which should be redirected to the Play Selection.

      • getUpperBoundSelection

        public int getUpperBoundSelection()
        Displays the UpperBound selection.
        Returns:
        the display of the requested UpperBound that was entered.

      • getUserConfirmation

        public void getUserConfirmation(int upperBoundComputed,
                       int maxNumOfGuesses)
        This method communicates with the Main.java to pull what the user enter as the Upper Bound. It then displays what that number is.
        Parameters:
        maxNumOfGuesses - type int displays max number of guesses
        upperBoundComputed - type int displays the upper bound computed

      • getGuessFeedback

        public char getGuessFeedback(int currentGuess,
                    int currentGuessIteration)
        This is a get method prints the number guessed by user to compare it to the system's guess.
        Parameters:
        currentGuess - type int displays max number of guesses
        currentGuessIteration - type int displays the upper bound computed
        Returns:
        userFeedback

      • getEndGameConfirmation

        public void getEndGameConfirmation(int guess,
                          int guessIteration)
        This is a get method prints the number guessed by user
        Parameters:
        guess - type int displays the system guess
        guessIteration - type int displays number of guesses
